crew.original_title: いばら姫またはねむり姫
crew.overview: On her fifteenth birthday the princess finds a diary written by her mother when she was young. The diary tells of the Queen's secret, early love. The Princess goes into the forest to meet her mother's former lover. When she looks into his eyes, she realizes why her mother had fallen in love...
crew.title: Briar-Rose or the Sleeping Beauty

crew.original_title: A Young Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
crew.overview: A modern riff of the 1889 novel by Mark Twain.
crew.title: A Young Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

crew.overview: A young man Jindrich goes looking for a princess only to find a girl in the country mill.
crew.title: The Watermill Princess

crew.overview: German/Czechoslovakian depiction of the famous fairy tale 'The Frog Prince', by the Brothers Grimm. When a young princess, instead of being fully dedicated to her love, persists in running around like a tomboy and roaming the forests with her gang, and a young prince refuses to give up all his vices and mischief, an aquaphobic fairy takes their fate into her hands. The princess then falls in love with the prince, who declares eternal fidelity to her.  When he however breaks this promise, the fairy turns him into a frog. With which the loyalty of the princess is being tested as well.
crew.title: The Frog Prince

crew.overview: In a remote Slovak village in the closing days of World War II, a schoolteacher and his young wife find a wounded Russian parachutist in their front yard just as the Germans are coming in to occupy their village. As his wife readily becomes involved with anti-Nazi partisans, the schoolteacher collaborates with the Germans in fear.
crew.title: The Coward
